questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have an Azure Databricks deployment and a local file named /tmp/file1 that contains the following code.

//IMG//


You need to read /tmp/file1 into a data frame by using Scala.

How should you complete the code? To answer, drag the appropriate values to the correct targets. Each value may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: it should be Multiline and json I think. Refer this link https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/databricks/query/formats/json

The multiline option is necessary when reading JSON files that span multiple lines per record. In the given example, each JSON object in the array is spread over several lines, which is typical for nested or complex JSON structures. Without enabling the multiline option, Spark would expect each JSON record to be on a single line, and it would not be able to correctly parse the provided file.
It should definitely be Multiline, json. The link shared by RutaP explains it.

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure subscription that contains a Microsoft Purview account.

You need to search the Microsoft Purview Data Catalog to identify assets that have an assetType property of Table or View.

Which query should you run?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct
Syntax explained here:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/unified-catalog-search#browse-the-unified-catalog



Grouping isn't supported within a field search. Customers should use operators to connect field searches. For example,name:(alice AND bob) is invalid search syntax, but name:alice AND name:bob is supported.

Selected Answer: B
Correct Purview syntax

choices.C: Add a Publish_config.json file to the root folder of the collaboration branch.
choices.B: From main, create a pull request.
choices.A: From featuredev, create a pull request.

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure subscription that contains an Azure Synapse Analytics account. The account is integrated with an Azure Repos repository named Repo1 and contains a pipeline named Pipeline1. Repo1 contains the branches shown in the following table.

//IMG//


From featuredev, you develop and test changes to Pipeline1.

You need to publish the changes.

What should you do first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct - you have nothing to do about main branch, which is a collaboration branch
